snippet: Demonstrations may soon end as the police whittle away at the main protest area and as students, pro-democracy lawmakers and academics wrangle over how to proceed.
abstract: News analysis; thousands of young people like university student Manni Ng in Hong Kong have learned firsthand just how daunting it is to go up against highly organized, uncompromising government in China; student protesters are now left wondering how to proceed after failure of demonstrators to surround city government complex and public support for their movement wanes.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and CHRIS BUCKLEY

lead_paragraph: Demonstrations may soon end as the police whittle away at the main protest area and as students, pro-democracy lawmakers and academics wrangle over how to proceed.

headline.main: For Hong Kong Protesters, a Spark to Keep Alive
headline.print_headline: For Hong Kong Protesters, a Spark to Keep Alive
